questions.question_text: A network engineer plans to upgrade the firmware of a Cisco UCS B-Series chassis by using the Auto Install feature. Which component is upgraded during the infrastructure firmware upgrade stage?

discussion.content:
Answer should be letter C: I/O Modules

Pag 663 of the DCCOR 350-601Official Cert Guide
Install Infrastructure Firmware: Install Infrastructure Firmware upgrades all
infrastructure components in a Cisco UCS domain, including the Cisco UCS Manager,
and all fabric interconnects and I/O modules

Selected Answer: C
I/o modules
c is the one
Answer seems right (https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/firmware-mgmt/gui/2-5/b_GUI_Firmware_Management_25/b_GUI_Firmware_Management_25_chapter_0111.pdf)

D and E are correct.

All configuration - An XML file that includes all system and logical configuration settings. You can use the file generated from this backup to import these configuration settings to the original fabric interconnect or to a different fabric interconnect. You cannot use this file for a system restore. This file does not include passwords for locally authenticated users. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/3-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_3_1/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_3_1_chapter_01001.html

Selected Answer: DE
d and e

questions.question_text:
An engineer must build a lab replica of a Cisco UCS production environment. The file must be imported into a new Cisco UCS cluster using a Cisco UCS Manager
GUI. The file must be in XML format and be exported from Cisco UCS Manager using an encrypted method. Which two configuration parameters should be selected to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B is Correct.

UCS-A /org/psu-policy # set redundancy grid
grid - Provides power redundancy when two power sources are used to power the chassis. If one power source fails, the surviving power supplies on the other power circuit continue to provide power to the chassis.

https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/cli/config/guide/1.4.1/CLI_Config_Guide_1_4_1_chapter28.html

UCS-A# scope org org-name 
UCS-A /org # scope psu-policy 
UCS-A /org/psu-policy # set redundancy {grid | n-plus-1 | non-redund} 
UCS-A /org/psu-policy # commit-buffer 


 grid —Provides power redundancy when two power sources are used to power the chassis. If one power source fails, the surviving power supplies on the other power circuit continue to provide power to the chassis.

n-plus-1 —Balances the power load for the chassis across the number of power supplies needed to satisfy non-redundancy plus one additional power supply for redundancy. If any additional power supplies are installed, they are recognized and powered off.

non-redund —Balances the power load for the chassis evenly across all installed power supplies.
B is the one

Correct

https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/cli/config/guide/1.4.1/CLI_Config_Guide_1_4_1_chapter28.html

choices.C: Assign the user ג€Employee1ג€ the network-operator role
choices.B: Assign users to a specific Cisco UCS locale
choices.D: Define a custom user role and assign it to users
choices.A: Modify the privilege level assigned to the user

questions.question_text: A Cisco UCS user called `Employee1` accidentally changed the boot policy of the Cisco UCS server at the Cisco UCS Manager root level. This change impacted all service profiles, and their storage connectivity was lost. The system administrator wants to prevent this issue from recurring in the future. The new security policy mandates that access must be restricted up to the organization level and prevent other users from modifying root policies. Which action must be taken to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
As the solution should restrict access up to the organization level, the right answer is B.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-1/m_role-based_access_control_conflguration.html#d18994e1993a1635

User Locales
You can assign a user to one or more locales. Each locale defines one or more organizations (domains) to which a user can access. Access is usually limited to the organizations specified in the locale.

Selected Answer: B
Answer Its B

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer.

B is the one.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B, question is asking to modify a policy to prevent this for "other users" not just one user.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-1/m_role-based_access_control_conflguration.html#d18994e1993a1635

Selected Answer: B
be as explained by the link provided by CactusJoe

Answer is B and E

Ext Lan Security (ext-lan-security)
This privilege allows a user to configure NTP providers, and date and time zone settings.

Ext Lan Policy (ext-lan-policy)
This privilege allows a user to configure LAN settings on a fabric interconnect, including Ethernet border ports, VLANs, LAN PIN groups, Ethernet SPAN sessions, LAN policies, and vNIC/vHBA placement policies.

Service profiles can add VLANs to vNICs that are configured in UCS Manager. So service profile is not valid solution.

Selected Answer: BE
B and E are correct.

Selected Answer: BE
B and E

Selected Answer: BE
Answer is B and E.

questions.question_text:
A new employee must be granted access to add VLANs into an existing Cisco UCS Manager and configure NTP synchronization with date and time zone settings.
Which two privileges must be granted to the employee to complete the task? (Choose two.)
